instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PLT_RESET: What is PLT_RESET? PLT_RESET stands for platform reset. When this is asserted the machine will not POST. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
No oxidation, no USB activity, cooler spins. Replaces <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>,03, the <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TONA</SIGNAL> voltage 0.67V , I found too low.
Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.59V; <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v; <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.3v; <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v;<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.87V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
Does VCORE drop from 1.15V to 0.87V?
If yes, board should boot.
Are you sure no USB activity?
Try PC3-10600 RAM modules, one at a time on each slot.
Did you try PRAM reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message: There is no activity on USB.  I tested a memory in each slot.  I will reset the PRAM when I get to the service.

threads.message: when I test with the multimeter in the <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TONA</SIGNAL> mesh the mac turns on, strange. Replaces the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>/02, but still with the defect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message: When I started to do the analysis it didn't show image and without activity in the USB, it replaces the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and the resistors, I didn't have result. Then,  replaces the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, the mac showed white screen, and was locked in the PRAM reset sound, after a certain time it did not give more image. I recorded the BIOS file you sent me and used another BIOS chip, but it didn't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
Try one RAM module (known good) on each slot at a time.

Do you still note the drop pulse on VCORE?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
The mac displays an image, but when I select MacOS, it freezes. And most of the time it doesn't give an image. Vcore 1.12V after a few seconds it drops to 0.87V. It looks like a RAM or CPU defect.
   I tested with RAM 10600 and 12800 module.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
"Vcore 1.12V after a few seconds it drops to 0.87V"
That is normal behaviour and I explained to you several times!
The drop voltage, means the board is booting.
However board can get stuck after few seconds; have to find a reason for that.
Did you reball SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message: Not yet. I'll do that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message: I changed the SMC, in the tests the board is with the same defect. In SMC it had a relief in one of the pads, so I replaced it.

threads.message: Do you get the same voltages like before?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> 3.30V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET</SIGNAL> 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
Board doesn't boot if VCORE stays at 1.12V.
I supposed wou already understood that.

Could be a simple bad resistor, until bad CPU.
Re-check all the job did on the board.
Be sure all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces are good.
Did you note droping voltage at pins 5 & 6 of <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message: YES, I already intended that Vcore has to stay between 0.85 and 0.9V. No RAM beep when you remove the memories. The pins 5 and 6 of the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> stay 0V, with pulse: pin 5 1.46V and 6 1.09V;

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image, on USB
threads.message:
"Replaces <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>,03, the <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TONA</SIGNAL> voltage 0.67V , I found too low."
Not low at all, really.
Be sure you've soldered correct values for <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03.
Check other job you did on the board too.
